results.title: Dame Margaret Scott
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Dame Margaret Scott talks about her experiences touring England with the “Sadler’s Wells Ballet” and “Ballet Rambert” during the Second World War and her association with choreographers John Cranko and Kenneth MacMillan. When a recurring back injury ended her dancing career, Scott moved to Australia and became a teacher. She offered to help Peggy van Praagh prepare dancers for the formation of the “Australian Ballet Company” and went on to establish the “Australian Ballet School”. Scott discusses the relationship between the school and the performing company and her desire to produce dancers with both a sound classical technique and an ability to adapt to the demands of contemporary dance.

results.title: Cha cha
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance Magic”.
Another in the series of instructional tapes in the art of ballroom dancing. Learn the cha-cha at home. It’s easy and its fun.

results.title: Freestyle nightclub
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance Magic”.
Enjoy learning steps in the Nightclub Disco format. The figures may be danced to contemporary or Top 40 music in a variety of settings such as nightclubs, discos and parties.

results.title: Dance frame
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase and WNYC-TV (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance By Doris Chase”.
The fluid motion of a dancer is circumscribed by rectangular frames of various colours. Accompanied by electronic music by Joan La Barbara and choreographed by Sara Rudner.

results.title: Motion
results.creator_credit: Murray Louis and Jack Lieb Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dance as an art form”
Part of a series designed to introduce dance as an art form. Illustrates how commonplace actions can be sensed and then transformed through selection, arrangement and skillful performance. Narrated by Murray Louis.

results.title: Shape
results.creator_credit: Murray Louis and American Federation of Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Dance”.
The sculptural dynamics of the dancer’s body is the focus of this film. The dancer is revealed as a sculptor who moulds and transforms himself into forms that lend their force to the eloquence of dance.
